plt.plot([a,b,c]) # [x-axis],[y-axis]
plt.title('Platform Mean')
plt.xlabel('x-axis')
plt.ylabel('y-axis')
print(plt.show())

value=[a,b,c]
activities = ['xbox one', 'xbox 360','xbox']
colors = ['r', 'g','c']
plt.pie(value, labels=activities, colors=colors, startangle=90, autopct='%.1f%%')
print(plt.show)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt; plt.rcdefaults()
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

objects = ('Xbox One', 'Xbox 360', 'Xbox')
y_pos = np.arange(len(objects))
performance = [a,b,c]

plt.bar(y_pos, performance, align='center', alpha=0.5)
plt.xticks(y_pos, objects)
plt.ylabel('Average Score')
plt.title('Xbox Bar Graph')

plt.show()

plt.plot([a,b,c,d,e,f]) # [x-axis],[y-axis]

plt.xlabel('x-axis')
plt.ylabel('y-axis')
print(plt.show())

value=[a,b,c,d,e,f]
activities = ['PlayStation', 'PlayStation 2','PlayStation 3','PlayStation 4','PlayStation Portable','PlayStation Vita']
colors = ['r','g','c','r','w','m']
plt.pie(value, labels=activities, colors=colors, startangle=90, autopct='%.1f%%')
print(plt.show)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt; plt.rcdefaults()
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

objects = ('PlayStation', 'PlayStation 2', 'PlayStation 3','PlayStation 4','PlayStation Portable','PlayStation Vita')
y_pos = np.arange(len(objects))
performance = [a,b,c,d,e,f]

plt.bar(y_pos, performance, align='center', alpha=0.5)
plt.xticks(y_pos, objects)
plt.ylabel('Average Score')
plt.title('PlayStation Bar Graph')

plt.show()

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt; plt.rcdefaults()
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

performance = [a1,b1,c1,d1,e1]
